objectDesc.p: Papyrus, 16.8x13.6, 16 extant leaf(s), 1 column(s), 27-30 line(s) per column, 35-40 characters per line, written in Greek/Latin.

additions.p: This glossary of unconnected Greek words and phrases with related Latin meanings could have been a school exercise. Sets of isolated words progress in verse order, but sometimes deviate from the pattern which could possibly indicate variant phrases.

history.provenance: Excavated 1952 by Hasan Mohammad al-Sammān and Muhammad Khalīl al-'Azzūzī at Dayr el Shayeb, Miṣr from a jar at the foot of Jabal Abū Mannā'.
Purchased 1952 by Martin Bodmer at Al Qāhirah, Miṣr from Phokio Tano.
Transferred to Chester Beatty Library at Dublin, Ireland.

msIdentifier.msName: BP XXI, Chester Beatty Library, Dublin, Ireland.

sourceDesc.bibl: Wouters, Alfpons, ed., “The Chester Beatty Codex AC 1499 a Graeco-Latin Lexicon on the the Pauline Epistles and a Greek Grammar”, Chester Beatty Monographs, no. 12, Peeters Publishers: Leuven, België, 1988. OCLC 638341191.
